content.full_text:
Certificate of Survey for William G. Cantrall, 5 September 18341 ChainmenJoshua M CantrillAdam M. Cantrill Surveyed forWilliam G. Cantrillthe following tract of land (to. wit) Begining at the South East corner of the West

half of the North East quarter of Section 20 in Township 17 North of Range 5 West—

at a White Oak— 20 inches in diameter bearing South 60 degrees West 33 Links Thence

West 31 chains &. 50— Links to a Hickory 20 inches N 48 W. 25 Links Thence North 20 chains to a stake Thence East 31 chains &. 50 Links to a

Spanish Oak 20 inches S 66 W 42— Links— Thence South 20 chains to the begining—2
paragraphs: Certificate of Survey for William G. Cantrall, 5 September 18341 ChainmenJoshua M CantrillAdam M. Cantrill Surveyed forWilliam G. Cantrillthe following tract of land (to. wit) Begining at the South East corner of the West
half of the North East quarter of Section 20 in Township 17 North of Range 5 West—
at a White Oak— 20 inches in diameter bearing South 60 degrees West 33 Links Thence
West 31 chains &. 50— Links to a Hickory 20 inches N 48 W. 25 Links Thence North 20 chains to a stake Thence East 31 chains &. 50 Links to a
Spanish Oak 20 inches S 66 W 42— Links— Thence South 20 chains to the begining—2

footnotes.text:
1Abraham Lincoln wrote the text of this survey, his own and Calhoun’s signatures, and
                  the list of chainmen.
2The land described here is located in northernSangamon County.

structured_content.text: Certificate of Survey for William G. Cantrall, 5 September 18341

Surveyed forWilliam G. Cantrillthe following tract of land (to. wit) Begining at the South East corner of the West
               half of the North East quarter of Section 20 in Township 17 North of Range 5 West—
               at a White Oak— 20 inches in diameter bearing South 60 degrees West 33 Links Thence
               West 31 chains &. 50— Links to a Hickory  20 inches N[North] 48 W.[West] 25 Links Thence North 20 chains to a stake Thence East 31 chains &. 50 Links to a
               Spanish Oak 20 inches S[South] 66 W 42—  Links— Thence South 20 chains to the begining—2
